page.title: All your base are belong to us

rev.comment: /* References in popular culture */ tagging reference which needs a citation; may have to remove the reference if no source is provided
rev.diff:
Line 31: Line 31:
*In February 2004, an automated [[news ticker]] on [[News 14 Carolina]], a North Carolina cable channel, was [[Hack (technology slang)|hacked]] to display the message on television.<ref>{{cite web | author=Poulsen, Kevin | date=[[2004-03-05]] | work=The Register | url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2004/03/05/wags_hijack_tv_channels_onscreen/ | title=Wags hijack TV channel's on-screen ticker | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
*In February 2004, an automated [[news ticker]] on [[News 14 Carolina]], a North Carolina cable channel, was [[Hack (technology slang)|hacked]] to display the message on television.<ref>{{cite web | author=Poulsen, Kevin | date=[[2004-03-05]] | work=The Register | url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2004/03/05/wags_hijack_tv_channels_onscreen/ | title=Wags hijack TV channel's on-screen ticker | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
*When Google launched [[Google Base]] in October 2005, the phrase was twisted into âAll Your Base Are Belong To Googleâ by search industry watchers such as [[John Battelle]].<ref>{{cite web | author=Battelle, John | date=[[2005-10-25]] | url=http://battellemedia.com/archives/001960.php | title=base.google.com (Or...All Your Base Are Belong To Google) | work=John Battelle's Searchblog | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref> Furthermore, in Google's [http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/ Hacker Translation], the "Personalized Homeâ link has been translated into "4LL `/0|_||2 B453,â which is [[Leet]] for "All Your Base."
*When Google launched [[Google Base]] in October 2005, the phrase was twisted into âAll Your Base Are Belong To Googleâ by search industry watchers such as [[John Battelle]].<ref>{{cite web | author=Battelle, John | date=[[2005-10-25]] | url=http://battellemedia.com/archives/001960.php | title=base.google.com (Or...All Your Base Are Belong To Google) | work=John Battelle's Searchblog | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref> Furthermore, in Google's [http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/ Hacker Translation], the "Personalized Homeâ link has been translated into "4LL `/0|_||2 B453,â which is [[Leet]] for "All Your Base."
â
*After Canadian politician [[Belinda Stronach]] infamously crossed to the [[Liberal Party]] from the [[Conservative Party]] (and destroyed the Conservative hopes of defeating the Liberal government on a confidence motion in the process), an internet user made an animated graphic spoofing the "All Your Base" animation with Canadian political figures. It was called "All Your Base Are Belong to [[Paul Martin]]," in reference to the then-prime minister who secured the Stronach deal.
+
*After Canadian politician [[Belinda Stronach]] infamously crossed to the [[Liberal Party]] from the [[Conservative Party]] (and destroyed the Conservative hopes of defeating the Liberal government on a confidence motion in the process), an internet user made an animated graphic spoofing the "All Your Base" animation with Canadian political figures. It was called "All Your Base Are Belong to [[Paul Martin]]," in reference to the then-prime minister who secured the Stronach deal.{{fact}}
*On [[2006-06-01]], the video hosting website [[YouTube]] was taken down temporarily for maintenance. The phrase "ALL YOUR VIDEO ARE BELONG TO US" appeared below the YouTube logo as a placeholder while the site was down. Some users believed the site had been hacked, leading the host to add the message "No, we haven't been hacked. Get a sense of humor." <ref>{{cite news
*On [[2006-06-01]], the video hosting website [[YouTube]] was taken down temporarily for maintenance. The phrase "ALL YOUR VIDEO ARE BELONG TO US" appeared below the YouTube logo as a placeholder while the site was down. Some users believed the site had been hacked, leading the host to add the message "No, we haven't been hacked. Get a sense of humor." <ref>{{cite news
